result.execSummary:
The defendant Stuart K. Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

With Huber and Good Time Credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence the defendant is currently serving.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart K. Kramer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:35 pm case called. Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson. Attorney Ulrich concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the Repeater enhancer. No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 20 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit, consecutive to any sentence currently serving. Credit for 3 days served. To begin no later than December 1, 2015. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample & surcharge. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: 11:05 am:  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court.   Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant did not appear.  P/S Requested and Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant regarding contact with Attorney Ulrich. Court instructs defendant to contact Attorney Ulrich.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 11:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Stuart Kramer present in court. Atty Ulrich appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Ulrich has not been able to make contact with the defendant and is requesting another STC. Victim did file a motion to modify the bond. The court declines to amend the bond in any way.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:05 am.
from the victim requesting to no contact  condition of bond be lifted - the Court will address at the next hearing

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting third party contact for child exchage purposes. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
